data.title: Lodging in Klamath County
data.meta_description: The Best Places with the Best Prices to Stay near Crater Lake National Park in Oregon. Airbnb, Hotels, Motels, and Lodges. The Best vacation area in Oregon.
data.text:
Looking for a place to stay while you enjoy the wilderness areas of The Upper Klamath Basin in Klamath County, Oregon?

Enjoy Crater Lake Nat'l Park, The Wood River Wetlands, Kimball State Park & The Wood River, Collier Memorial State Park & Spring Creek, The Williamson River, or The Spraque River.

Also, visit The Kla-Mo-Ya Casino and the Fort Klamath Museum while you are here.

Aspen Inn

Offering competitive seasonal rates and running special offers throughout the year. Senior discount offered for persons 65 yrs. or older. Located in the historic town of Fort Kamath in the Klamath Basin just a few minutes from Crater Lake Nat'l Park.

Air BnB Rental "Awesome Cabin Near Crater Lake"

This is unique, handcrafted. rustic 1 bdrm vacation cabin comfortably sleeps 4 with a queen bed in the bedroom and a futon in the living room. Full kitchen and laundry. Large outdoor deck with BBQ. Woodburning stove & electric heat. TV in living & bdrm for watching movies that are provided. There is no cable TV. The cabin is kept stocked with needed cooking items such as seasonings, cooking oil, flour, sugar, coffee, teas, and a few other items. Alder wood chips are supplied for use in the BBQ. Located 30 min. from Crater Lake Nat'l Park in beautiful Chiloquin, OR.

Crater Lake Resort

Crater Lake Resort offers affordable year-round lodging near Crater Lake National Park. Private cabins are clean and beautifully done with motel-like interiors, including kitchens, both on and off Fort Creek. Creek side cabins offer beautiful views as well as private decks with gas BBQs. They also offer tent sites and full RV hookups with camp fire pits throughout our property. Located between Fort Klamath and Chiloquin, Or. by Crooked Creek.

Jo's Motel

Offering clean, comfortable rooms with firm beds, flat screen TV, DVD Player and free DVD's to watch as well as fridge and microwave, private carport, A/C, and gas fireplace. Get away from the news with NO WI-FI and NO TV RECEPTION OR CABLE. Relax, play a game, or join a campfire by the Wood River. Located in Fort Klamath, Or.

Kla-Mo-Ya Casino Sleep Inn Hotel

This brand new 76 room hotel was opened in the fall of 2018. It has a Swimming Pool and Hot Tub and rooms come with a continental breakfast. Located just 3 miles south of the Chiloquin exit on Highway 97.

Melita's Motel & Cafe

Offering a full service restaurant, motel rooms and and RV camping, free Wi-Fi, A/C, and pets are allowed. Located right on Highway 97 across from The Chiloquin Airport. (small non-manned airstrip) Great for flying your plane into for an outdoor adventure.

Super 8

Stop into the Super 8 Klamath Falls hotel for a comfortable stay at this dog-friendly, AAA-approved, two-diamond hotel. Located at the Highway 97 and 140 intersection near the City of Klamath Falls.

Water Wheel RV Park and Campground

The Waterwheel RV Park is located in one of the Oregon's premiere recreation areas just 30 miles from Crater Lake National Park. At 4200 feet in elevation on the Williamson River with blue skies and a mild climate, this is an ideal camping location whether you enjoy fishing, boating, hunting, bird watching, or seek a peaceful mountain backdrop to relax.

Heartline Ranch

Here's a real unique place to stay in TP'S and while your there enjoy beautiful scenic guided horseback rides. Truly a unique experience!

The Upper Klamath Basin is a unique and beautiful area in southern Oregon and northern California. It is an area of rugged mountains, deep forests, and cascading rivers, and is one of the most biodiverse regions in the United States. The Klamath Basin is home to over 200 species of fish and wildlife, including the endangered Lost River and shortnose suckers, bald eagles, ospreys, and many more.

The Upper Klamath Basin, which includes the Klamath and Lost Rivers, is an important source of water for the region. The Klamath River is the largest river in Oregon and the second largest in California, and is also one of the most important salmon-producing rivers in the West. The Upper Klamath Basin also provides habitat for several species of endangered fish, including the Lost River and shortnose suckers.

The Upper Klamath Basin is a major agricultural area, with many farmers and ranchers relying on the water from the Klamath River to irrigate their crops. The Upper Klamath Basin is also home to the Klamath Tribes, a group of Native American tribes that have lived in the region for thousands of years. The Klamath Tribes have historically relied on the water in the Klamath Basin for fishing, hunting, and other activities.

The Upper Klamath Basin is also home to several protected areas, such as the Klamath National Wildlife Refuge, Klamath Marsh National Wildlife Refuge, and the Sprague River Wildlife Refuge. These protected areas provide important habitat for many species of fish, birds, and other wildlife. The Upper Klamath Basin is a unique and beautiful area that is home to many special species of wildlife and plants.

The area is an important source of water for the region and is home to the Klamath Tribes, who have relied on the Klamath Basin for thousands of years. The area is also home to several protected areas that provide important habitat for many species of fish, birds, and other wildlife. The Upper Klamath Basin is an important part of the region and is essential to the health and well-being of the area's people, wildlife, and environment.
